com.innowhere.jnieasy.core.typedec
Interface VarTypeNative

public interface VarTypeNative

The native variable type is the interface that represents a native declaration of a field member of a native structure/class/union or a formal parameter of a method. It must be seen as the native type of the declaration of a variable.

This approach tries to mimic in a native world how Java works. Java clearly distinguishes a reference from the object itself:

NativeStringAnsi str = new NativeStringAnsi();
The native view of the new NativeStringAnsi object is described with TypeNative and the native view of the str reference is VarTypeNative.

In Java a reference is ever like a pointer to the object (reference and object are different "variables" on Java memory), with JNIEasy, a Java reference declared "by value" is not a pointer (using a native memory point of view), it is the object itself if was declared as a structure field, or represents a copy in the stack native memory of the passed parameter if was declared as a formal parameter of a method.

Returning to the example, if str is a field of a structure (in JNIEasy a C/C++ structure is represented using a user defined Java class), using the same Java semantic, str can access as a pointer to the string addressed (str may be null) if was declared as pointer, or access to the embedded character array statically allocated in the structure (str can not be null and must be defined first) if was declared by value.

Again, if str is a formal parameter of a method, can represent a pointer to the passed NativeStringAnsi if was declared as a pointer, or holds itself a char array with a fixed length on the stack and copies the argument (JNIEasy can pass arrays by value).

The generic Pointer class (and user defined classes as pointers) is provided to satisfy the need of more control of the native memory (losing transparency, and "natural" Java programming), avoid it unless you really need it.

Is not mandatory use native wrappers, following the example a String reference can be used instead of the wrapper class as a char* or char[n] structure field member or a formal parameter of a method.

Author:
Jose M. Arranz Santamaria

Method Detail

getType

TypeNative getType()
Returns the native type of this native variable type declaration.

size

long size()
Returns the native memory size of this native variable type.

If the variable type is "by value", the size is the same as the related native type. If "by pointer" the size is the pointer size of the platform.

Returns:
the native memory size of the variable type.
See Also:
TypeNative.size()

preferredAlignSize

long preferredAlignSize()
Returns the preferred native alignment size of this native variable type.

If the variable type is "by value", the alignment size is the same as the related native type. If "by pointer" the size is the pointer size of the platform.

Returns:
the preferred native alignment size of the variable type.
See Also:
TypeNative.preferredAlignSize()

getVarConv

int getVarConv()
Returns the variable conventionalism code of this native variable type.

Native typeConventionalismsDefault
Primitive BY_VALUE BY_VALUE
Primitive wrappers (Integer etc) and native wrappers (NativeInteger etc) BY_PTR BY_PTR
String, StringBuffer and wrappers BY_PTR BY_PTR
Structure, class or union Both BY_PTR
Array (normal, wrapper or user defined) Both BY_PTR
Pointer or user defined Pointer BY_PTR BY_PTR
Method (all types) BY_PTR BY_PTR

See Also:
TypeNative.decVarType(int)

byValue

boolean byValue()
Returns true is variable conventionalism is by value.

Returns:
true if conventionalism is by value.

byPointer

boolean byPointer()
Returns true is variable conventionalism is by pointer.

Returns:
true if conventionalism is by pointer.

getDeclarationString

java.lang.String getDeclarationString()
Returns a normalized string representation of the native variable type.

The method NativeVarTypeManager.dec(String) called with this string returns a new native type equals to this.

Returns:
the normalized string of the native variable type.
See Also:
TypeNative.getDeclarationString()

getVarTypeManager

NativeVarTypeManager getVarTypeManager()
Returns the utility object to declare native variable types.

Returns:
the NativeVarTypeManager object.

getTypeManager

NativeTypeManager getTypeManager()
Returns the utility object to declare native types.

Returns:
the NativeTypeManager object.

decArray

TypeNativeArray decArray(int[] dims)
Declares a native array type using this native variable type as the element array type and specified dimensions.

Current implementation is: 

 return getTypeManager().decArray(dims,this);

Parameters:
dims - the lengths of the array dimensions.
Returns:
the native array type of the declaration.
See Also:
NativeTypeManager.decArray(int[],VarTypeNative)

decArray

TypeNativeArray decArray(int length)
Declares a one-dimensional native array type using this native variable type as the element array type and specified length.

Current implementation is: 

 return getTypeManager().decArray(length,this);

Parameters:
length - the length of the array.
Returns:
the native array type of the declaration.
See Also:
NativeTypeManager.decArray(int,VarTypeNative)

decPointer

TypeNativePointer decPointer()
Declares a native pointer type wrapping the specified declaration of the pointer member.

This native variable declaration must be declared "by pointer".

Current implementation is: 

 return getTypeManager().decPointer(this);

Returns:
the native type of the declaration.
See Also:
NativeTypeManager.decPointer(VarTypeNative)

decParameter

NativeParameterDec decParameter()
Declares a method parameter using this variable type.

Returns:
the parameter declaration.

decParameter

NativeParameterDec decParameter(boolean varargs)
Declares a method parameter using this variable type and specifing if the parameter is a variable argument number holder. Only Java arrays (Object[], char[] etc) are valid to declare vararg parameters.

Parameters:
varargs - if true the parameter is a variable argument number holder.
Returns:
the parameter declaration.
See Also:
NativeParameterDec.isVarArgs()
